review: I only gave 3 stars because it worked with my Dell Laptop but it didn't work with my Apple products. I read Chromecast forums with other buyers experience the same difficulty when using a ARRIS TG862 modem from Comcast/Xfinity. The Chromecast also needs to be about 10-12 feet from your modem. It works but not as I expected. The Netflix, Pandora, Crackle, etc., Apps work well once installed on the laptop. Easy steps to connect/hook-up the Chromecast.
author: elira

review: I like to watch movies/tv shows while I work on my computer.  Before chromecast, I would play Netflix or Xfinity Go in a tiny window in the corner of my screen.  Constantly adjusting and moving around the tiny window so I could see my work and/or the show.  With chromecast,  I launch the chrome browser load up my Netflix show, hit the chromecast icon in the upper right of the browser.  Now the show is on my TV!  I minimize that browser window on my computer and work away.  I totally forget that my computer is even running the image on my TV.I didn't give 5 stars because1.  I couldn't use xfinity go with chromecast on my tablet.  It does work with my laptop, but I wanted to use my tablet so that the source would be totally unobtrusive.2.  It can be skippy.  By this I mean the image hesitates occasionally. It might be my wifi.  I am going to look into getting a range booster.3.  There isn't security on the chromecast.  I believe you have to be connected to the same network to push to it.  But anybody in the house could push anything to the tv.  I think there should be some kind of password possible.
